Heute setzen wir auf Selbstverantwortung sowie Gestaltungs-Drive jedes einzelnen und das ganz im Sinne von "Smart People. Smart Tech."Für unser DBA-Team, welches Infrastruktur und Serversysteme für unsere Produktentwicklung bereitstellt und weiterentwickelt, suchen wir einen Oracle Datenbankadministrator aus Leidenschaft.Welche Aufgaben warten auf dich?Als „Datenbankadministrator (m/w)“ installierst und betreibst du in- und externe Oracle-Datenbankumgebungen über alle Stages.Dabei unterstützt du unsere Entwicklungsteams und Kunden. Du stimmst Releasetermine mit den Kunden ab und optimierst/automatisierst Wartungs-, Release- und Rolloutprozesse sowie Backup- und Recoverykonzepte.Dafür nutzt du u. a. Shell Scripte für Linux oder Microsoft Windows.Du holst das Beste aus unseren Servern und Datenbanken heraus und leistest damit einen essentiellen Beitrag zu unserem Ziel, leistungsfähige und performante IT-Anwendungen bereitzustellen.Neben der Installation, Administration und Konfiguration von Datenbanksystemen und Application Servern gehören auch Betriebssysteme (Linux, Windows (Server)) zu deinen Aufgabenbereichen.Du arbeitest im engen Austausch mit unseren agilen Entwicklungsteams und hast die Möglichkeit, eigenverantwortlich in einem professionellen Team mit flachen Hierarchien und kurzen Entscheidungswegen unser Produkt maßgeblich mit zu gestalten.Welche Technologien nutzen wir?Oracle (11g, 12c)Oracle WebLogic ServerIBM WebsphereJEEPL/SQLVMWare ESX(i)LinuxMicrosoft Windows (Server)Citrix XenAppWas erwarten wir von dir?Du bringst dich mit Begeisterung, Engagement und Leidenschaft in unser Team ein.Dein Talent als Datenbank Administrator hast du durch mehrjährige berufliche Erfahrung erfolgreich weiterentwickeln können.Mit Oracle Datenbanken und SQL kennst du dich sehr gut aus.Extrapunkte bringen dir Erfahrungen mit und Interesse an Netzwerktechnologien, Virtualisierung (VMWare ESXi) und hardwareseitigen Serverlösungen.VLAN, VPN und Subnetting sind keine Fremdworte für dich.Wenn zudem Eigenverantwortung, Entscheidungsfähigkeit und Teamorientierung zu deinen Stärken zählen, dann freuen wir uns auf deine Bewerbung.Du findest bei uns ein solides Umfeld mit der richtigen Mischung aus spannenden Themen, hohen Freiheitsgraden, aktiver Wissenscommunity, After-Work-Parties und strukturierter Weiterentwicklung.Bei Fragen wende dich an:Amelie Sötje, People & Organisation Partner Tel. +49 451 1408-9206Jetzt bewerbenSmart InsurTech GmbH | Hansestraße 14, 23558 Lübeck| www.smartinsurtech.de
jobtitle: Datenbankadministrator (m/w) für unsere Oracle Produktumgebung at Smart InsurTech GmbH (Berlin, Deutschland)

description: About the roleThe challenge: Bringing data science to productionWe have created a platform that gives data scientists a flexible, consistent, and simple environment based on Docker containers, where their code can be written in a large variety of languages (Python, R, Scala).Your job would be to work with our customers, select the right approach and tools for the problem while also providing feedback from your usage of our platform to help shape its roadmap.You would support a wide range of use cases ranging from customer service analytics to IoT projects.The stackPython, scikit-learn, R, Scala, Spark, MLLib, XGBoost, TensorFlowAdditional technologies you might get in contact with: Go, Docker, Kubernetes (see our Go Engineer position).Your profileYou have a strong background in mathematics or another scientific discipline. You are curious and have an affinity for statistical thinking. You are comfortable with programming (e.g. with Python or Scala). You like to understand things and don't fall for buzzwords.Interested?Let's schedule a brief 20min session to get to know each other.About usWho we areContiamo is a Berlin-based, fast-growing tech company.We are tech-driven and keep a close watch on recent scientific developments and emerging technologies. We love open-source. We are a very international team with interesting people from all over the world (95% of us have relocated to Berlin).How we workWe strongly believe in the importance of uninterrupted time to get stuff done and quality over quantity when it comes to working hours. We prefer to keep our schedule meeting-light and work in a library-like atmosphere during the core hours.We believe the ability to give and get constructive feedback and express divergent ideas is crucial to make innovation come to life. We live a very open discussion culture and prefer the evaluation of ideas based on merit over top-down decision making.We strongly believe in ownership of one's features, from spec to implementation to operation. We also understand that ownership comes with a sense of responsibility towards others that depend on the results of our work.We believe that that everybody should be able to find meaning in their work. We match assignments based on both ability and individual interests and discuss your progress and individual needs every 3 months.We don't see people as "resources" and genuinely care about each other. We also understand that there's more than fancy perks and cool events to people's satisfaction and engagement. We continuously work towards an environment providing a lot of autonomy, transparency and development opportunities and rely on everybody's feedback to hold us accountable for maintaining our high standards.About the interview processHow we get to know each otherWe like to start out with a brief 20-30min session for a mutual introduction. We tell you about our company, product and culture and are happy to answer any questions you might have. From your side, we're mostly interested in understanding what kind of challenges you're looking for, what technologies you'd like to work with and what role you'd like to be in.If both sides agree that this could be a good fit, we move on to a more technical session. We ask you to walk us through one of your past projects as if we were new colleagues joining you on the job. The ability to communicate effectively and concisely about complex systems and trade-offs between different approaches is key.In a second technical session, we discuss some of the technologies and concepts you have used. We also give you a walk-through of our product and solutions, discuss our architecture and components. Finally we try to scope your initial role and focus — should you be joining us.In the last session, we discuss the remaining details, logistics and plan your relocation.We see the interview process as a mutual opportunity to get to know each other — at eye level. That's why we won't ask you to work for free on any coding assignments and always strive for responding within hours, not weeks.
jobtitle: Senior Data Scientist (Python/Scala) at Contiamo (Berlin, Germany)

You must feel comfortable to acquire, install and upgrade computer components and software, provide automation and maintain security policies.Furthermore you will use the latest technologies and industry’s best practices to deliver a professional enterprise IT infrastructure. The role requires a person who can work collaboratively with a young, creative team, in an agile software development environment. You shall be responsible for the estimation, design, implementation and testing of all assigned tasks.Joining us as a System Administrator, you will be contributing in the following fields of work:Automation of provisioning and configuration of workstations and serversSupporting and assisting teams in different environments and scientific fieldsImprovement and extension of existing infrastructure and its codeSetting up bare-metal machines, VMs and micro instancesCreation of automated testing and deployment environmentsWhat we expect from you:A great System Administrator at Autonomos can’t be defined. Due to the fact that everyone is different there is more than one way to get the work done. But to be successful in this role, this is the kind of profile we have in mind:IT specialist vocational education, Bachelor’s degree/ Master's degree or Diploma in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Software Engineering or other relevant field of studyA minimum of 1 year of hands-on, recent experience in relevant field of occupationKnowledge of workstation, server, database and network administrationKnowledge in administration of multi-platform environments like Linux/Windows/MacOS as well as ability to work and assist user in different environmentsExpert-level proficiency in Linux environmentExperience working with configuration management stacks and automationExperience in user and rights managementKnowledge of IT securityKnowledge of shell scriptingExperience with PythonTeammate accustomed to accelerated development cycles with a track record of meeting deliverablesWhat would be beneficial for you to have:Knowledge of monitoring, diagnostics and log analyzing as well as documentation and evaluationExperience in an agile development life cycleExperience with release management and testing as well as setting up testing environmentsKnowledge of version control software such as GitExperience with DockerWho we are:We are a diverse and talented team who is motivated by the will to make a change. Our goal is to establish new technologies in those real-life applications where they add extra value. We like to have fun together - there is no sense in coming to a job every single day if you don’t like the people you work with. As a new colleague you will work in an international environment with talented coworkers in our Berlin office. We work in small independent focus groups but help each other to succeed and collaborate across teams whenever possible. Our company’s culture is based on flat hierarchies, a constructive failure culture and mutual respect.What we offer you:Competitive salaryPerformance bonusEmployee discountsPaid relocation Company pension schemeFlexible working hoursTicket Plus bonus cardVisa sponsorFree fresh fruit, coffee, tea, water and several other drinksWant to join us?We want to meet you. To get the full story about this vacancy or the application procedure, please contact us via email at jobs@autonomos.xyz.Please note that a technical evaluation and a pre-employment screening are part of the selection process.We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, or disability status.To learn more about Autonomos visit http://www.autonomos-systems.com.

description: As a Senior Engineer on our Writing Tools team, you will join a small, accomplished team building software to help students become better writers.  We are helping students to research & cite sources, while avoiding plagiarizing the works of others.  Our products reach over 30 million students from across the US, and more throughout the world.You will be helping to architect a system to analyze both internal & external data sources to:detect document similarity (possible plagiarism)advise students on writing style & grammaridentify areas of study for students to improve their communication skillsOrganization: Writing ToolsThe Writing Tools platform is currently composed of four of the largest student citation services in the world - EasyBib.com, CitationMachine.net, Bibme.org, and CiteThisForMe.com. Spend your Friday afternoons hacking on a side project of your choosing.We do at least one off-site every year, where the tech teams from Berlin, Sofia, and São Paulo gather to hack together. In the past we've gone to Bulgaria and Greece.Our lean processes allow us to ship new features and functionality on a weekly basis.Infrequent regular meetings – most days you'll do a standup and get to work.We have a close, welcoming, and international community; we get together regularly for brunches, cocktail nights, football, yoga, and office parties.All the startup swag you expect: kicker table, beer in the fridge, and a shiny MacBook Pro.If you want to know what it’s like to work at SumUp check our careers page: https://sumup.com/careersIf there's something you'd like to ask, feel free to get in touch: taryn.bonugli@sumup.com

description: Your goal – to improve the education process and better the lives of students -- through engineering.As an front-end engineer on our Writing Tools team, you will join a small, accomplished team building software to help students become better writers.  Our stack is React with Redux on the front-end, PHP, Ruby, & Elixir on the back-end.Organization: Writing ToolsThe goal of the Writing Tools Team is to provide students with effective writing solutions to better their academic careers. Currently composed of 4 of the largest student citation services in the world - EasyBib.com, citationmachine.net, bibme.org, and citethisforme.com, the team reaches students from all over the world. The sites each have millions of unique visitors a year (almost 30 million combined) and has the potential to make a broad impact on students’ lives throughout the world.Role:Engineers play an integral part of the Chegg Writing Services team. Citations play a crucial role in students’ writing process, proven by the thousands of schools who have registered to use EasyBib. As a requirement of any academic writing, citations also service the needs of creators of content, by offering credit where credit is due.Students struggle with the citations process, and Chegg offers fast and accurate solutions to this problem. Our sites reach almost 30 million users a year and reach students at all grade levels. The Chegg family consists of 4 of the largest online citation services in the world. The role will create and improve existing backend services fueling all of our citation services.We develop multiple products in parallel, in small dedicated teams. We are proud to work on high-quality code using modern development methods and technologies. Continuous integration and delivery, automated tests and quick development turnarounds are cornerstones of our development agenda.The ideal candidate likes to think outside the box, is interested in constantly improving themselves and their team by education and feedback, and wants to give back some of their work to an open source community. They love tackling new problems, deploying frequently, thinking on their feet, and coming up with new ideas.Responsibilities:Working in a small development team to maintain current and implement new featuresBuild efficient, clean and reusable React componentsParticipate in feature discussions, code, and design reviewsRequirements:                  Several years experience writing modern JavaScriptExperience with React, Redux and automated testing with JestActive interest not only in application code but also great software architectureGreat communicator both verbal and writtenMust be a team player and work well in a team environmentPreferred:Experience working with large scale REST and/or graphQL API’sKnowledge of performance optimization approaches and technologies for web applicationsExperience with back-end technologies such as PHP, Ruby, or Elixir

description: Our Android developers have a passion for pushing mobile technologies to the limits. description: SAP’s vision is to help the world run better and improve people’s lives.As the cloud company powered by SAP HANA®, SAP is a market leader in enterprise application software, helping companies of all sizes and industries run better. SAP empowers people and organizations to work together more efficiently and use business insight more effectively. SAP applications and services enable our customers to operate profitably, adapt continuously, and grow sustainably.At SAP, we believe in the power of collaboration and empower our employees to perform at their best in an environment that encourages free and open expression of ideas. You’ll work alongside creative thinkers who share your interests, while turning big ideas into reality for our customers. With innovative job training, mentors to help you grow, and the flexibility to balance your work and personal life, you’ll be able to get more out of your career. It’s no wonder that some of the sharpest minds from around the world are working for a company that is consistently recognized as a global top employer.Now it’s your turn to take the next step and help make the world Run Simple.PURPOSE AND OBJECTIVESThe SAP Innovation Center Network is a strategic innovation entity within SAP, combining software engineering excellence with thought leadership and entrepreneurial spirit. Across various focus clusters and by building on strong teams, we pioneer game-changing solutions in close collaboration with startups, customers & partners in industry and research as well as with other SAP units. To ensure a successful go-to-market, we follow an end-to-end responsibility approach. By exploring unconventional ideas and developing inspiring proofs of concepts, we push the state-of-the-art in computer science and its applied fields to provide SAP with foresight into future trends. As a (Senior) Machine Learning Developer, you will work with an expert team in a startup-like environment focusing on building of new, cloud-based solutions as part of the SAP Leonardo Machine Learning portfolio. Your primary goal will be to build from ground up end to end machine learning solution. You are a self-starter, lean startup-minded, and born for life in fast paced environments. As an ideal candidate, you have built cloud-based data processing systems which scale vertically and horizontally to support millions of transactions per second. You will have the chance to work in a free-thinking environment with a single purpose – to delight and amaze our users.EXPECTATIONS AND TASKSAs part of the SAP Innovation Center Network team, you will help us research and create applications that empower businesses. You will be working in a fast-paced environment, communicating and collaborating with designers, software engineers, and product managers, as well as our partners and customers.Work through user given problems from beginning to end: translating research insight into adequate concepts for SAP’s customers.Model complex sets of data in ways that are easy to comprehend: Create information & software architecture, interaction models, screens designs and fine grained details of user & software interactions.Own the success or failure of your work and collaborate with other designers, developers, and customers on the feasibility of ideas.Sketch and prototype ideas to test viability and how interactions feel.Develop the proposed solution end to end with the teamWork together with customers & stakeholders to determine solution ideas and to validate the proposed solutionDesirability of your solutions and appealing end-user UIs are core driving principals for everything you developImmerse yourself quickly into new topics, terminology and end user tasks.EDUCATION AND QUALIFICATIONS / SKILLS AND COMPETENCIESRequiredMaster or Bachelor degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Operations Research or related fieldTrack record of developing novel machine and deep learning algorithms and systems. Motivation to keep up to date with latest research.Proficiency in handling of multi-terabyte datasets in distributed Linux/Unix environmentsExperience with Machine / Deep Learning software packages such as Caffe/Torch/Theano/TensorFlowExperience in data analysis to get tangible information form the data. Ability to visualize data and present core insights in a clear and compelling way. Strong desire to overcome obstacles and make your work benefit SAP's customersExcellent English language skillsPreferredTrack record of prior work experience or internships in the area of software engineering or data sciences.Knowledge in the area of ERP and business applicationsSelf starter and team player who can deeply collaborate with team members and stakeholdersWORK EXPERIENCE2+ years of academic of practical experience in deep learning / machine learning / data sciences with a focus on innovationLOCATIONWalldorfEXPECTED TRAVEL0 - 10%SAP'S DIVERSITY COMMITMENTTo harness the power of innovation, SAP invests in the development of its diverse employees. We aspire to leverage the qualities and appreciate the unique competencies that each person brings to the company.

description: Veolia ist der weltweite Maßstab für optimiertes Ressourcen­management. Das Unter­nehmen entwickelt und verwirk­licht Lösungen für die Bereiche Wasser-, Ent­sorgungs- und Energie­manage­ment im Sinne einer nach­haltigen Ent­wicklung der Kommunen und der Wirtschaft. In Deutschland arbeiten mehr als 12.000 Mitar­bei­te­rinnen und Mitar­beiter an den über 200 Stand­orten von Veolia und seinen Beteili­gungs­gesell­schaften. Zusammen mit seinem Tochter­unter­nehmen ÖKOTEC Energie­manage­ment GmbH sind wir aktiver Gestalter der Energie­wende. Gemeinsam identifi­zieren und realisieren wir Energie­ein­spar­maß­nahmen bei unseren Kunden. Mittels unserer inno­vativen Software EnEffCo® sorgen wir darüber hinaus für eine trans­parente Nach­haltig­keit der umgesetzten Maßnahmen.Vor dem Hintergrund eines wachsenden Kundenstammes und umfassenden neuen Entwicklungen suchen wir  für unser Tochterunternehmen ÖKOTEC Energiemanagement GmbH  an unserem Standort BerlinSoftwareentwickler / Informatiker (m/w)Nr. 79756Nach einer intensiven Einarbeitung werden Sie zunehmende Verantwortung für die Programmierung von Teilbereichen bis hin zu Softwaremodulen und Gesamtfunktionen bekommen. Ihre Tätigkeit erfolgt in enger Abstimmung mit unserem Entwicklungsteam.Sie wirken mit bei der Entwicklung unserer EnEffCo®-Software:Entwicklung Browser-basierter Anwendungsoberflächen für PCs und mobile EndgeräteProgrammierung komplexer Prozesse zur Verarbeitung und Analyse von DatenProgrammierung von Schnittstellen zu Geräten und anderen DatensystemenProgrammierung kundenspezifischer Zusatzmodule und von Prototypen für innovative Erweiterungs-ModuleMitwirkung bei der Konzept-EntwicklungSupport, Fehlersuche, Implementierung von KundensystemenDer Schwerpunkt Ihres Einsatzbereiches wird unter Berücksichtigung Ihrer Fähigkeiten und Interessen gemeinsam mit Ihnen festgelegt.Ihr Profil:Abgeschlossenes Informatikstudium oder vergleichbare Ausbildung mit entsprechender ZusatzqualifikationSehr gute Kenntnisse in C# oder Java, JavaScript, HTML und SQLVertraut im Umgang mit Visual Studio, Microsoft SQL Server, Web-Forms sowie in modernen Web-Applications-ArchitekturenVon Vorteil sind Erfahrungen über Daten-Schnittstellen z. B. OPC UA, Modbus, MSCONS, TCP/(S)FTP-ProtokollGrundkenntnisse in Physik und Mathematik, insbesondere im Bereich Messgrößen und deren Umrechnung, sollten vorhanden seinSehr gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse in Wort und SchriftGewissenhafte und strukturierte Arbeitsweise, analytisches DenkvermögenWir bieten Ihnen:Eine Arbeits­atmosphäre, in der Engagement wahr­genommen, gute Ideen aufgenommen und eine Kommu­nikation auf Augenhöhe gepflegt wird – das schafft Ihnen optimale Einstiegs- und Ent­wicklungs­möglich­keiten in einem zukunfts­orien­tierten Unternehmen.Wenn Sie diese Heraus­forderung reizt, freuen wir uns auf Ihre aus­sage­kräftige Bewerbung unter Angabe Ihrer Gehalts­vor­stellung und des frühest­möglichen Eintritts­termins unter folgendem Link: https://www.veolia.de/karriere/arbeiten-bei-veoliaFür nähere Informa­tionen stehen wir Ihnen gerne unter Telefon +49 30 536397-30 oder energie@oekotec.de zur Verfügung.

description: About the roleThe product: A containerized data science environmentOur ambition is to create a platform that gives data scientists a flexible, consistent, and simple environment based on Docker containers, where their code can be written in a large variety of languages (Python, R, Go, Scala). This tool then turns their code into stateless functions, that can be easily deployed into powerful data pipelines.The stackDocker, Kubernetes, Rancher, AnsibleThe challengeHaving great DevOps engineering support is crucial in order to guarantee that our micro-service based platform runs smoothly and reliably, no matter where it is deployed (we support cloud and on-premise deployments).Our components are mostly written in Go, with some Scala and a bit of Python mixed in and all of them expose well-defined interfaces. We always keep operational requirements in mind when developing new services.We're looking for someone who can actively drive our roadmap in the area as part of our technical operations team, who can evaluate new technologies and wants to be a great partner for the rest of the tech team.Your profileYou have senior-level experience with complex production deployments, know your way around Kubernetes and have in depth operational experience with at least one of the big three cloud providers (AWS, gcloud, Azure).Software engineering experience is a big plus, particularly in Go.About usWho we areContiamo is a Berlin-based, fast-growing tech company. We offer a flexible data platform enabling businesses to create interactive, data-driven decision tools and automations. Our mission is to combine sophisticated data science with a great user interface and experience.We are a tech-driven company and keep a close watch on recent scientific developments and emerging technologies. We love open-source. We are a very international team with interesting people from all over the world (95% of us have relocated to Berlin).How we workWe strongly believe in the importance of uninterrupted time to get stuff done and quality over quantity when it comes to working hours. We prefer to keep our schedule meeting-light and work in a library-like atmosphere during the core hours.We believe the ability to give and get constructive feedback and express divergent ideas is crucial to make innovation come to life. We live a very open discussion culture and prefer the evaluation of ideas based on merit over top-down decision making.We strongly believe in ownership of one's features, from spec to implementation to operation. We also understand that ownership comes with a sense of responsibility towards others that depend on the results of our work.We believe that that everybody should be able to find meaning in their work. We match assignments based on both ability and individual interests and discuss your progress and individual needs every 3 months.We don't see people as "resources" and genuinely care about each other. We also understand that there's more than fancy perks and cool events to people's satisfaction and engagement. We continuously work towards an environment providing a lot of autonomy, transparency and development opportunities and rely on everybody's feedback to hold us accountable for maintaining our high standards.About the interview processHow we get to know each otherWe like to start out with a brief 20-30min session for a mutual introduction. We tell you about our company, product and culture and are happy to answer any questions you might have. From your side, we're mostly interested in understanding what kind of challenges you're looking for, what technologies you'd like to work with and what role you'd like to be in.If both sides agree that this could be a good fit, we move on to a more technical session. We ask you to walk us through one of your past projects as if we were new colleagues joining you on the job. The ability to communicate effectively and concisely about complex systems and trade-offs between different approaches is key.In a second technical session, we discuss some of the technologies and concepts you have used. We also give you a walk-through of our product and solutions, discuss our architecture and components. Finally we try to scope your initial role and focus — should you be joining us.In the last session, we discuss the remaining details, logistics and plan your relocation.We see the interview process as a mutual opportunity to get to know each other — at eye level. That's why we won't ask you to work for free on any coding assignments and always strive for responding within hours, not weeks.

Research at BIMSB combines state-of-the-art high-throughput technologies with Bioinformatics, molecular biology, biochemistry and engineering to gain a comprehensive and fundamental understanding of different biological systems. The successful applicant will join an international team of interdisciplinary scientists on a vibrant research campus in Berlin, Germany.The recently established Bioinformatics research group of RNA Structure and Transcriptome regulation (Prof. Meyer) seeks an experienced scientific programmer and Linux systems administrator to support the research of the Meyer group. Guix) and packaging software from source (.rpm, .deb)experience deploying software on different settings, in particular on shared-user high-performance clustersexperience in working with, installing and managing linux machinesexperience in setting up web-servers or proxy (e. g. Apache) and in automated system deployment and linux configuration management (e. g. Puppet)Desired skills:experience in Bioinformatics research, in particular analyzing high-throughput sequencing dataexperience in algorithm designworking knowledge of network storage, hardware, file system management, backup and recoveryexperience working in an international environment and interdisciplinary research settingoral and written communication skills in German (considered a plus, but not essential)Certificates:essential: BSc or MSc in Computer Science or Bioinformatics/Computational Biology or another science discipline with a strong focus on devising and employing computational methodsessential: a minimum of 2 (Msc) or 3 (BSc) years of experience as scientific programmerdesired: Red Hat Certified Engineer or Ref Hat Certified System AdministratorSalary: German TVÖD (Bund/Ost) E13, depending on qualification and experience Start date: as soon as possible Application deadline: November 12, 2017 Limitation: The position is initially offered for 2 years, with the possibility for further extension beyond the initial 2-year contract.For further information please contactIrmtraud Meyer (irmtraud.meyer@mdc-berlin.de) or Altuna Akalin (altuna.akalin@mdc-berlin.de)Please submit your complete application by indicating the registration number 10851/2017 as a single pdf-file by email to Sabrina Deter (sabrina.deter@mdc-berlin.de) includingletter of motivation (1 page max)CV including relevant experienceuniversity and other relevant certificatesfull contact details of 2 or more refereesThe MDC is an equal opportunity employer and supports gender equality.MAX-DELBRÜCK-CENTRUM FÜR MOLEKULARE MEDIZINMore information: www.mdc-berlin.de/bimsbMAX-DELBRÜCK-CENTRUM FÜR MOLEKULARE MEDIZINMore information: www.mdc-berlin.de/bimsb

description: At HelloFresh, we want to change the way people eat. Over the past 5 years we've seen this mission spread beyond our wildest dreams. So, how did we do it? Our weekly recipe boxes full of exciting recipes and lovingly sourced, fresh ingredients have blossomed into a community of inspired, energised home cooks that expands across the globe. We’re now active and growing in 9 different countries in 3 continents.Our story started in Berlin. As Europe’s tech hub, and the home of our global headquarters, it’s a dynamic, progressive environment where innovation is nurtured and promoted. Since we started, we’ve worked exceptionally hard and we’ve received more than US$ 300 million in investment which together have allowed us to create an award winning product and become one of the top 3 largest companies to come out of Europe over the past 4 years.As a member of HelloTech you’ll be exposed to a modern technology stack and a slick cross functional agile team setup. We have developed a refined product and provide scalability on a global level. Join our HelloTech team and help us to build a fresh food global champion!About the jobAs a Big Data Engineer at HelloFresh, you will be collaborating to build one of the most advanced big data platforms in Europe. You will develop distributed services that processes data in near-time and real-time, with focus on scalability, data quality and integration of machine learning models. Plan, Implement and maintain distributed, service-oriented and message-oriented data platform components Design, build, and maintain data ingestion, ETLs and infrastructure for batch and near real time processing.Build and maintain Business Intelligence and reporting solutions.You can get a taste of what we've been working on by checking out our engineering blog.Who we’re looking forDegree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or equivalentExperience in Software EngineeringFluency in Python and OOPExperience with Apache Spark, Hive, Impala, and KafkaExperience with Hadoop, plus distributions like Cloudera, MapR or HortonworksExperience with RDBMS such as PostgreSQL or MySQLExperience with NoSQL data stores such as MongoDB, Redis or CassandraAgile team-working experience Test-Driven DevelopmentPreferred: Experienced with data modelling, design patterns, building highly scalable and secured solutionsPreferred: Experience with Amazon AWS and DevOps and AutomationPreferred: Familiarity with performance metric toolsPreferred: Knowledge of visualization tools (Tableau, Qlikview)What we offerThe opportunity to get into one of the most intellectually demanding roles at one of the largest technology companies in EuropeCutting edge technology, allowing you to work with state-of-the-art tools and software solutionsCompetitive compensation and plenty of room for personal growthGreat international exposure and team atmosphereWork in a modern, spacious office in the heart of Berlin with excellent transport links and employee perksAre you up for a challenge?Please submit your complete application below including your earliest starting date and salary expectations.We’re committed to making HelloFresh as inclusive as we can be. As part of that commitment we chose to be transparent about our diversity data. To enable us to build an accurate picture of our workforce, we ask some optional questions in our application process.

description: Hallo! Bonjour! Hi!We believe that everybody should have the chance to learn a foreign language. Languages are about much more than simple everyday communication, they are a unique window into a rich world of diverse and colourful cultures. Babbel exists to offer everybody the chance to learn languages.Babbel offers 14 learning languages - from English to Indonesian - and, since founding in 2007, we have grown to become the market leader in app-based language learning. There are 500 of us from over 42 different countries working hard to keep this going - we call ourselves ‘Babbelonians’.We want to inspire change and create even more. That’s where you come in.As our Backend focused Software Engineer, you will be self-motivated, full of ideas as well as energy and collaborate with other talented engineers in making our software even better.So, from one kind of language to another, we are looking to talk with enthusiastic and dedicated Software Engineers who speak our language….Ruby/Rails. description: YOU ARE READY TO MAKE AN IMPACTZalando Lounge is an online shopping club for fashion and lifestyle products in 11 European countries. We offer our members daily, time-limited sale campaigns with discounts of up to 75% off the recommended retail price. However,  Zalando Lounge is so much more than discounts. Our strength lies in our focus on fashion: from sought-after labels to niche brands, from famous international names to trendy luxury brands, we make sure to meet the fashion taste of all our customers, who are always on the hunt for the best products at the best prices. Working with our brand partners, we're pioneering innovative supply-chain and production processes and offer them an impactful and smart solution, creating a new way to shop for fashion - and a new way to sell.Our Tech department builds and drives our own customer facing applications and services on top of Zalando’s platform services. We have a strong focus on customer experience and learn and experiment how we can engage  them even more.As an Engineering Lead for our frontend team at Zalando Lounge in Berlin you will be in charge of creating an attractive webshop by driving and challenging the development of new product features and ensuring a highly efficient and performant customer-facing webshop. Furthermore your role as an Engineering Lead at Zalando Lounge will directly impact the growth and overall tech vision of the business.YOU ARE SETTING STANDARDSDelivery: You easily find your way and lead your teams through completing the transition from our legacy system to a modern tech stack, creating new product features and ensuring high availability and scalability of our webshop.Vision: You develop and execute mid- and long-term technical visions and architecture with your teams, while closely aligning with Product Managers, UX Designers and other Engineering Leads to be in line with the overall tech strategy.Collaboration: You facilitate collaboration between different engineering teams and align with the Zalando Fashion store on future frontend strategies and tech stacks.Impact: Ensure the overall company expansion by creating a scalable architecture and achieving technical resilience of the webshop to high traffic.Growth: You attract and retain diverse talents and act as key contributor in developing overall technical skills by working one-on-one with Javascript Engineers of Zalando Lounge. Furthermore, you promote forward-thinking engineering practices, high code-quality standards and a strong feedback culture across your teams.YOU ARE SKILLEDExperience: 5+ years experience and at least 2+ years working on customer-facing applications, working hands-on with pure Javascript and modern tech stacks, such as React and Node. You are also experienced in working with and connecting to backend APIs. For more information check out our Tech Radar.Leadership: Leading, developing and mentoring an international team of software engineers, having 3+ years of experience as a team lead working on high-traffic applications in an agile way.Passionate: In topics around customer-facing products and being able on having a high impact on shaping the product as a whole of a rapidly expanding business.YOU ARE OFFEREDCulture. A workplace where trust, empowerment and feedback are valued; 100+ internal guilds; tech talks; product demos; coder dojos.Perks. Competitive salary; great shopping discount on a wide range of products on zalando.com; discounts from external partners; public transport discounts; relocation assistance for internationals; municipality services; flexible working times; additional holidays & volunteering time off; diverse sports and health offerings.Development. Extensive onboarding; personal branding support focused on leadership; opportunity to attend and speak at conferences.Peers. International, accomplished experts and self-organized, autonomous teamsWANT TO JOIN US?Want to join us? Then go ahead and apply!If you need guidance or have any questions about our hiring process, please contact our recruiter Antonia Samanns.

description: That's usBecome part of Daimler Group’s unique electronic payment system ‘Mercedes pay’! It enables payments on-the-go from our customers’ smartphone and makes the products and services we offer even more appealing. As leading provider of digital mobility services, Mercedes pay is a fundamental component of Daimler’s mobility and digitalization strategy.Our vision: the customer of tomorrow can pay for fueling/charging, washing, parking, workshop services and many others with our self-designed e-wallet.The projectThe mission of the team is to create a cloud based middleware that connects our core paying platform ‘Mercedes Pay’ with various service applications used by our customers and clients. We want to grow our microservice architecture and continuously expand services, features and paying methods. Our ePayment system is deployed worldwide, used by millions of customers and connects several platforms from various functional domains.Your roleYou will play a key role in ensuring fast and reliable delivery of our core transaction systems and their integration layers. You will contribute clean and secure code to be deployed in predominantly virtualized environments and containers.You work in close collaboration (pair programming, coding dojos, etc.) with other team members and teams dispersed across Europe to understand requirements and incorporate them into ‘Mercedes pay’Developing and maintaining an easily testable and rapidly deployable system along the entire integration and testing pipeline by using TDD, BDD, DDD, CI/CDYou contribute your leadership strength and experience to build up a new developer team from scratch and frequently on-board new colleaguesAs the senior you lead and drive tasks and deliverables pro-actively and show self-confident to inspire your co-workers As skills and requirements you have:Successfully completed a degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a similar qualificationExperience in developing software for web services in a cloud environment and work experience with current CI/CD management toolsKnow-how to design a system following the Behavior/Domain-Driven Design approach to develop a growing microservice landscapeA proven track record of object-oriented design, architecture and developmentGood working knowledge of agile approaches, e.g. Scrum, XP, Kanban, etc.A pioneer mindset to learn new technologies and frameworksClean Code and SOLID principlesYour work environmentYou will be based at our brand new and unique office in the heart of Berlin. The building offers spacious offices and meeting rooms and excellent connectivity to public transport.The teamAs a self-organized and agile team we work collaboratively to solve complex problems outside of the car. We are an international team of experts which is just about to be built up. Our spirit is determined by a pioneering footprint and the eagerness to build services that make daily mobility easier and hazzle-free.The recruitment processWhen you have applied successfully, you’ll be invited for a phone interview with one of our experienced tech recruiters.If our recruiter believes you are suitable for the role, you will be asked for a Skype interview with the project’s technical lead.The last stage includes a face to face interview at our office in Berlin or Stuttgart, depending on your current location. This is usually with the technical lead, one of our developers and a hiring manager. Usually there will be a small hands-on code challenge.

description: YOU ARE READY TO MAKE AN IMPACTZalando Lounge is an online shopping club for fashion and lifestyle products in 11 European countries. We offer our members daily, time-limited sale campaigns with discounts of up to 75% off the recommended retail price. However,  Zalando Lounge is so much more than discounts. Our strength lies in our focus on fashion: from sought-after labels to niche brands, from famous international names to trendy luxury brands, we make sure to meet the fashion taste of all our customers, who are always on the hunt for the best products at the best prices. Working with our brand partners, we're pioneering innovative supply-chain and production processes and offer them an impactful and smart solution, creating a new way to shop for fashion - and a new way to sell.Our Tech department builds and drives our own customer facing applications and internal services on top of Zalando’s platform services. We have a strong focus on customer experience and learn and experiment how we can engage them even more. Being a member of a tech department, consisting of about 50 engineers, UX designers and product managers, this position will allow you to directly impact the business mission of Zalando Lounge. As Senior Backend Engineer in our team you will work hands-on in Go to design and develop next generation tooling for all our internal processes, which will support key business units in enhancing their performance through technology.YOU ARE SETTING STANDARDSVariety. Together with your team, product managers and UX designers you will drive the development of our internal systems, ensuring efficient and user-friendly tooling. You will also be responsible of shaping a scalable and performant architecture of the internal systems that you will be working on.  Autonomy. Due to the size and startup-like set up of the tech team you will have the opportunity to decide together with your team on technical frameworks being used and have the opportunity to implement best practices whilst the team is growing.Ownership. You will have end to end responsibility of all of your projects and will focus on building scalable and cloud ready software solutions in our AWS and API-first tech environment.Excellence. Due to your business mindset you are continually thinking about new ways on how to help Zalando Lounge scale through building a strong technical platform and automated business processes. You build systems for production and implement high-quality solutions, ensuring latency, availability and appropriate monitoring.YOU ARE SKILLEDExperience: You are experienced in integrating external and internal API services and are excited about building modern tooling operations.  Technologies. You would like to do hands-on coding in Go and are highly skilled in at least one of the following programming languages: Go, Java or Scala. Previous experience working in cloud environments such as in AWS is a plus. Check our Tech Radar for more information on the technologies we use.Business mindset. You have a business mindset and are continuously thinking about new ways on how to improve Zalando Lounge through effective and strategic development of internal systems.Knowledge Exchange. You will lead and mentor team members in terms of best practices, code quality and tech frameworks.YOU ARE OFFEREDCulture. A workplace where trust, empowerment and feedback are valued, 100+ internal guilds, tech talks, product demos, coder dojos.Perks. Competitive salary, great shopping discount on a wide range of products on zalando.com, discounts from external partners, public transport discounts, relocation assistance for internationals, municipality services, flexible working times, family service and parent & child rooms, additional holidays & volunteering time off, diverse sports and health offerings.Development. Extensive onboarding, personal branding support focused on leadership, opportunity to attend and speak at conferences.Peers. International, accomplished experts and self-organized, autonomous teams.WANT TO JOIN US?Want to join us? Then go ahead and apply!If you need guidance or have any questions about our hiring process, please contact our recruiter Antonia Samanns.

description: YOU ARE READY TO MAKE AN IMPACTAt zLabels we create inspiring fashion brands for the online generation, such as mint&berry, Even&Odd, Zign and Kiomi. Our data-driven way of doing business means that our decisions are backed up by consumer behaviors and translate directly into relevant product selections. Developed for the digital market from day one, we’re confident to navigate the changing retail landscape and take pride in being always fast, always fresh.To extend the reach of our fashion brands and enter new markets, we are building our own technical platform, such as our own system to manage stock and completing business transactions systems separate to the Zalando tech platform. Being a member of a tech department, consisting of about 30 engineers and product managers, this position will allow you to directly impact the business mission of zLabels. As Senior Backend Engineer (Java and/or Python) at zLabels you will create and maintain our  internal ERP system, which will support key business units in enhancing its performance through technology.YOU ARE SETTING STANDARDSVariety. Together with your team you will build, scale and continuously improve our ERP platform improving functional areas of the business such as Finance, Procurement, Logistics, Merchandising and Selling. These different areas demand a lot of integrations (with multiple systems) and tooling to improve the daily business.Autonomy. Due to the size and startup-like set up of the tech team you will have the opportunity to decide together with your team on technical frameworks being used and have the opportunity to implement best practices whilst the team is growing.Ownership. You are taking ownership of, and being responsible for providing strong technical architecture of the distributed systems that you will provide to key business units, such as Procurement, Finance or Logistics.Excellence. Due to your business mindset you are continually thinking about new ways on how to help zLabels scale through a strong technical platform and synchronize it with distributed systems of the Zalando tech platform.YOU ARE SKILLEDExperience. You have a strong background in working on and setting up ERPs and integrating them with multiple systems. You have also worked on creating architecture for technical solutions that have direct impact on the business scalability and profitability.Technologies. Your preferred choice of coding hands-on is in Java and/or Python. You also have an understanding of APIs, REST, SOAP and have previously worked with distributed systems that  included CRM or ERP tools. Previous experience with AWS and Javascript is a plus. Check our Tech Radar for more information on the technologies we use.Business mindset. You have a business mindset and are continuously thinking about new ways on how to improve zLabels through effective and strategic development of internal systems.Knowledge Exchange. You will lead and mentor team members in terms of best practices, code quality and tech frameworks.YOU ARE OFFEREDCulture. A workplace where trust, empowerment and feedback are valued, 100+ internal guilds, tech talks, product demos, coder dojos.Perks. Competitive salary, great shopping discount on a wide range of products on zalando.com, discounts from external partners, public transport discounts, relocation assistance for internationals, municipality services, flexible working times, family service and parent & child rooms, additional holidays & volunteering time off, diverse sports and health offeringsDevelopment. Extensive onboarding, personal branding support focused on leadership, opportunity to attend and speak at conferences.Peers. International, accomplished experts and self-organized, autonomous teams.WANT TO JOIN US?Want to join us? Then go ahead and apply!If you need guidance or have any questions about our hiring process, please contact our recruiter Antonia Samanns.
jobtitle: Senior Backend Engineer to create internal ERP system (Python/Java) at zLabels GmbH (Berlin, Germany)

description: We offer excellent opportunities for a creative and passionate software architect to spread the word about the software development framework that rules them all – Qt.About the RoleQt (pronounced “cute”) is the leading C++ cross-platform application and UI framework in the world. Headquartered in Finland, The Qt Company is responsible for Qt development, productization and licensing under commercial and open-source licenses. The Qt Company has over 260 employees in Product Management, R&D, Sales, Marketing and Consulting Services with several offices worldwide.The Qt Company Service Team helps large global customers to reach their targets by providing them advisory services both in Qt software framework and customer’s software solution. These services include guidance on the use of Qt APIs, functions, methods and programming techniques for all major platforms.As a key member of this team, for the Automotive market segment, you will contribute primarily to the In-Vehicle Infotainment (IVI) systems and/or instrument cluster systems. You will represent the Qt Company as technical lead towards a customer on varying project tasks including, but not limited to, requirements, design, and delivery of applications. These applications primarily use Qt, usually on embedded Linux based platforms. You will also collaborate with Qt’s R&D department to apply the latest Qt technologies on your concrete customer use case.You need to be enthusiastic, have a proven track-record of successful application development in the embedded environment. You should be interested in problem solving and quickly adapt to changing technical environments. You will need to work fluently and with pride in the customer interface as a recognized specialist of your own technical subject – A tip of the spear for the technologies we represent. Main Responsibility AreasLeads design, architecture and development efforts for Qt’s Automotive customers (Tier-1s or OEMs)Analyze requirements, functional specifications against the target hardware Create software design for applications developed with Qt and its interaction with other library components on the IVI stackInterface with customers on system architecture through workshops and design meetingsIdentify and address system level metrics, such as: resource consumption, performance, boot time and inter-application communicationPresent technical solutions to customersProvide support to the customer’s development organization; the go to person for any Qt related technical assistanceFocus primarily on securing customer success in using Qt Software products in the Automotive marketRegular travelling to customers Your qualificationsBachelor’s degree in Computer Science or higher (not mandatory)Preferably 5+ years of working on large software programsExperienced and talented developer with deep understanding of one or more of the following:Strong C++ experience with successful track record in developing C++ applicationsExperience with major automotive Tier-1s and/or OEMs, with prior IVI or Cluster architecture is a big plusStrong exposure to Embedded Linux adaptation and Qt including Yocto projectExcellent Technical understanding of Qt Software Products (Qt, Qt for Embedded Linux, Qt tools) LocationBerlin or Southern area of Germany / Suburbs of Detroit, USA Interested?For more information, please contact:Bernard Falise, bernard.falise(a)qt.io / European positionsPat McGowan, pat.mcgowan(at)qt.io / USA positions

description: This job ad goes out to all the visionaries who want to find a purpose in what they are doing and take accountability.With Blinkist we’ve created a meaningful product that is growing fast. Our blinks, key insight summaries of the world’s best nonfiction, help more than 3 million people around the globe to keep learning new, exciting things, each and every day.In 2017, our app received the World Summit Award, granted by the United Nations, in the Learning & Education category, as well as a Google Material Design Award for Brand Expressiveness.Why do we need you?We have 2 Rails apps: Magazine & WebApp. The Magazine is focused on launching meaningful A/B tests and creating great responsive signup flows. The WebApp is focused on providing a great experience for existing users – reader, payments, etc. Both projects require Frontend, so we are looking for someone who will organize them, build a system and drive Frontend at Blinkist. This is where you come in.As one of our Growth Developers you will:Implement and run A/B tests to optimize all of our web pages and funnelsWork closely with designers and marketers to ideate and define features and testsDig into our data and analyze test results and new opportunitiesConduct code reviews and participate in regular meetings to ensure quality and alignmentCreate code that follows our motto “The more standards, the better” To do this, we believe you should have:5+ years of Ruby on Rails development experienceGreat skills in Web technologies such as JavaScript, HTML, CSS, BEM, etc.Familiarity with concepts of A/B testingPassion for writing clean, elegant, and easily-testable codeA SOLID attitudeWhat's in it for you?At Blinkist, we offer a fantastic workplace in the heart of Berlin-Neukölln including all the benefits you’d expect – from a personalized perk system to free drinks, fresh fruit, and furious foosball fights, plus the nicest, smartest bunch of coworkers. Add a competitive salary, flexible working hours, and a meaningful product on the rise, and you have a first impression of why Blinkist is a great place to work.We got rid of classical management hierarchies and, instead, distributed authority among all colleagues. We foster a unique company culture championing self-empowerment, personal development, direct communication and mutual support. Not only do we want you to grow into the role of Rails Frontend Engineer, but we want this role to grow with you.If we’ve captured your interest, apply now and let us know why you are the perfect fit for the job!
jobtitle: Rails Frontend Developer (m/f) at Blinkist (Berlin, Germany)

description: We are disrupting an entire industry. In 2017 more than 50% of the retailers need a new cash register. We are building the most mobile-native way to manage stores: meet Tillhub. We are are an award winning team consisting of experienced entrepreneurs and software developers. Based in Berlin, we have already acquired many very promising clientsiOS DeveloperNow it is time for us and you to grow our team even further. We are looking for a talented, passionate, and resourceful iOS developer who shares our vision and wants to build something exciting and fresh. Our vision is to create a much better point of sale and help retailers to win in their businesses in the 21st century.Your profileYou are a passionate engineer who loves to write clear, well designed and reusable codeYou are an excellent iOS-Developer with outstanding skills in Swift, well knowing Objective-CYou gained at least 3 years of experience in the implementation of professional mobile projectsYou are an enthusiast for technical challenges tweaking the use of third-party APIs and SDKs to maximum stabilityYou work well inside a team with a strong sense for quality in an agile environmentYou have extended experience with Core Data, UIKit, concurrency handling and synchronization of sensitive data via REST-APIs. You are familiar with Unit- and UITests mainly inside XcodeExperience with complex application architecture and database design is highly preferred, knowledge of other SQL-databases is a plusYour role  You will be an essential part of a small team of iOS-developers. In close collaboration with the backend engineers you will help building the Tillhub-application for iPads. New features are waiting for your implementation.Tasks will be planned together with the whole IT-team. You take responsibility in executing them - giving and receiving feedback along the process. We will always help each other to create the best product possible.Flexibility is a very important factor to satisfy our customers and win new ones. Still we favor maintainability and extensibility over shortcuts - even if we admit that they are sometimes necessary. With your input also planning and documentation will improve.We use Jira and Confluence, Slack, GitHub, Fabric and CocoaPods.We aim to replace the majority of the remaining Objective-C legacy code and are looking forward to Swift 4.We offerBased in Berlin Kreuzberg, you will be part of our fine international team and shape the success of Tillhub. Your work has direct and noticeable impact on our product. Regular internal tech talks, skill-building events, as well as retrospectives will help you achieve mastery with us. We believe in flat hierarchies, limited meetings and fast honest talk. A monthly feedback day will help you receive valuable feedback from your peers and supervisors. Having awesome team events and a feeling that you change people’s lives all day long complete our offer. In our new and modern office in Kreuzberg, you will be provided with fruits, drinks, fancy chairs and a nice view to our newly built garden.We are looking forward to meet you!

description: What we offer:So what’s the team like? What started as a university project has grown organically over the last seven years into a distinctly international crew. We keep things open, agile and communicative, with pair programming widely practiced and encouraged. It is all based on trust – no micromanaging, no distributed teams, no nearshoring, no offshoring – face to face communication is premium. That is why the whole development team is located together in one office in beautiful Berlin!We are constantly evolving and looking to integrate new technologies in our technology stack. We currently:Version with GitBuild with Gradle and WebpackWrite Java 8 and ECMAScript 6 codeManage with NPMTest with TestNG, Selenium, Mocha and KarmaAutomate with JenkinsUtilize React and ReduxOrganize with Scrum and KanbanYou are free to use the OS and IDE of your choice, the tooling you are comfortable with and setup your workspace the way you like it.Our engineers are self-organized within their teams, working on components and independent projects together and closely with product managers and UX designers. We value your thoughts and ideas and will give you the freedom to push and implement them.We get that balancing a family and work can be a challenge, so everyone (family or no family) gets flexible work hours. Work when you work best.We support personal growth, both in and outside of the company. You will gain – and share – knowledge during recurring learning lunches, jours fixes, pizza sessions and our annual code camp.How you will contribute:We are looking for a QA Automation Expert to strengthen our development team in Berlin. You will help to continue to develop and improve our leading cloud-based business process modeling, decision modeling and workflow software.Specifically you will:Drive the QA automation topic at SignavioDiscover the requirements of the development and elaborate solutionsDevelop and enhance automated quality assurance processes during development, test, deployment and operations phase (continuous integration)Improve our test frameworks for backend (Java) as well as frontend (JavaScript) testingReview the work of your teammatesThis is you:Solid experience in automating development processes and testsDeep knowledge in working with Jenkins and SeleniumExperience in the following programming languages and technologies: Java, JavaScript, Gradle, Tomcat, JSON, XML, TestNG, JBehaveBasic knowledge of database systems like MySQL, MS SQL Server, Oracle, IBM DB2Basic experience in using code coverage (jacoco, cobertura) and code analysis tools (FindBugs, Sonar)A degree in an IT-related areaThe motivation to work in an agile environmentThe drive to understand the needs of our customersExperience in using GitVery good communication skills in English, German is a plusBeing part of a motivated team with flat hierarchies you know the importance of communication and feedback. You are appreciated for your engagement, your constructive input and your relentless drive to improve yourself, the product, and the company.What we value most:Be creative and innovative: Push ideas to create a product that our customers love to use, and minimize complexity.Be passionate and create impact: Create amazing work and inspire others with your results.Work independently and responsibly: Take responsibility for your own actions and think about your tasks.Communicate and build trust: Communication is key to achieving our goals efficiently.Be honest and selfless: Admit your own mistakes, be open to feedback, and make time to help your colleagues.

description: "Mit Kompetenz und Engagement arbeiten wir am sichersten Provider der Welt" lautet die Vision, die sich unser Team von derzeit rund 35 Kollegen an unserem Standort Berlin-Prenzlauer Berg gegeben hat. Teilen Sie unsere Vision? Dann machen Sie mit -- beim Testsieger der Stiftung Warentest.Für unsere E-Mail-Provider mailbox.org und ox.io und unseren Geschäftsbereich Heinlein Hosting suchen wir Softwareentwickler (m/w) für unsere Webinterfaces und API-Backends, die gerne Verantwortung übernehmen. Besonders für folgende Arbeitsprofile:Softwarearchitektur in PHP und JavaScriptMicroservicesContinous Integration und DeploymentAufbau einer hochskalierenden Plattform für <n> Millionen NutzerIhr AufgabenfeldWir entwickeln Kommunikations- und Sicherheitssoftware für unsere Plattformen und benötigen einen erfahrenen Programmierer für Planung, Umsetzung und Weiterentwicklung der passenden Benutzerschnittstellen und zugehörigen Backend-Funktionen. Die Sicherstellung einer hohen Code-Qualität durch Reviews, Unit-Tests und Refactorings gehört genauso zu Ihrem Aufgabenfeld, wie die Analyse und Behebung von Fehlern und Anpassung der Applikation. Sie arbeiten in einem charmanten Team von 5 bis 6 Entwicklern + Teamleitung, unterstützt durch Scrum-Coaching und Projektmanager, sowie durch die Systemadministratoren unserer Plattformen. Ihr Hauptauftraggeber sind unsere Produkt-Teams und Projektmanager aus unserem Haus.Ihr ProfilSehr gute Kenntnisse in PHP und JavaScript (Angular)Arbeitsfähig in Python und bashHTML und CSS (LESS/SASS) gehören für Sie zum AlltagswortschatzSie beherrschen einen strukturierten Programmierstil und koordinieren sich gut im TeamIm Bedarfsfall gehen Sie mit Kunden und Geschäftspartnern sicher und vertrauensvoll umStreben nach steter Steigerung der Code-Qualität durch agile ArbeitsmethodenInteresse an permanenter Fortbildung und EntwicklungGute Deutsch-Kenntnisse, gute Englisch-KenntnisseZusatzqualifikationen (nicht zwingend erforderlich)Sie können mit Linux umgehenSie haben Erfahrung mit MicroservicesSinnhaftigkeit, Teamarbeit & FlexibilitätSinnvolles Arbeiten: Sie sind wesentlich daran beteiligt, mailbox.org zum sichersten E-Mail-Anbieter der Welt auszubauen und so auch in Zukunft eine sichere und freie Kommunikation zwischen unseren Kunden zu ermöglichen. Außerdem unterstützen Sie unseren seit 1989 existierenden ISP JPBerlin.de mit seinen sozial- und politisch engagierten Kunden und Organisationen sowie unsere Geschäftskunden bei Heinlein Hosting. - Wir bieten also einen vielfältigen, interessanten und verantwortungsvollen Arbeitsplatz.Ein tolles Team: Sie arbeiten in einem kollegialen Team mitten in Berlin. Eigeninitiative und Mitdenken werden bei uns besonders unterstützt -- auf offene Kommunikation und Kollegialität legen wir großen Wert. Mindestens zwei Teamevents im Jahr und eine wöchentliche Mittags-Kochrunde freuen alle Kollegen, die dabei sein wollen.Lebenslanges Lernen: Unsere hauseigene Heinlein Akademie lockt mit spannenden Fortbildungen Admins aus ganz Europa nach Berlin – und bietet für uns selbst natürlich ebenso zahlreiche Möglichkeiten, Neues zu erlernen und Vorhandenes zu vertiefen.Sehr gute Rahmenbedingungen: Flexibilität in der Arbeitszeit für die Verbindung von Familie und Beruf sind für uns selbstverständlich. Ein angemessenes Gehalt, Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten und Freizeitausgleich, wenn es mal hoch her ging, gehören für uns genauso dazu wie eine angenehme Arbeitsatmosphäre, frisches Obst und unser Masseur, der einmal die Woche vorbeikommt.Ihre BewerbungWir freuen uns auf Ihre vollständigen Bewerbungsunterlagen (inkl. Gehaltsvorstellung). Diese richten Sie bitte ausschließlich per E-Mail mit PDF/JPG-Anhängen (keine MS-Word-Dokumente) an jobs@heinlein-support.de.Ihr Ansprechpartner bei Fragen ist der Teamleiter der Developer, Yan Minagawa. Sie erreichen ihn telefonisch unter: 030 / 405051-60.

description: At Wayfair, we are looking to grow our Site Reliability Engineering team by bringing on board a talented Senior DevOps Engineer (m/f) to help manage the large scale physical and virtual server environment that underpins our global e-commerce platform. Though the focus of this team is Linux, due to the nature of our platforms you will be involved with and exposed to a wide variety of systems. This team owns a large portion of our customer facing systems and services, and as such are heavily involved in the architecture, growth, and improvement of our various platforms. Ever wondered what it would like to work at ‘internet scale’? At Wayfair we are dealing with internet scale challenges on a daily basis. With our traffic doubling year over year consistently we are faced with some pretty exciting and interesting challenges!Some projects the team is currently working on in 2017:Create and improve tools to aid in monitoring and control of our systemsEnhance our infrastructure to support a variety of different disaster recovery optionsExpansion of current physical data centersMigrating targeted applications, sites, systems to cloud platformsImproving automation of systems, processes, and servicesLooking to the future - containers? Mesos?Responsibilities include:Taking POC Systems and preparing them for production use by applying our standards to them and making them immutableProvide the highest level of technical escalation within the organization of our critical production platformsImprove security and performance of infrastructureAutomate, Automate, AutomateProvide Architecture & Design feedback for all production platforms, as well as for other teams with in the organizationProactively monitor systems to anticipate business needs before they become critical pathThinking of what is the next big infrastructure thingQualifications:5+ Years experience in a SRE/DevOps type roleExperience managing Linux in a large scale environmentExperience working with Linux automation tools, such as Puppet, Chef, etc.Knowledge of Web Servers (Apache/Nginx)Familiarity with load balancing tools and techniques (HAProxy, etc)Experience working in virtualized environmentsExperience working with Cloud Platforms (AWS/Azure/GCP)Scripting ability particularly in Bash, PHP, Python or RubyOther traits we look for:Good interpersonal and team building skillsAn easy-going attitude and sense of humorA positive, people-oriented and energetic attitudeA strong drive to learn and try new thingsAn analytical, creative, and innovative approach to solving problemsAn interest in being challenged in a fast-paced environment, and having fun while doing it
jobtitle: Senior DevOps Engineer (m/f) at Wayfair Europe (Berlin, Germany)

description: You Are Ready To Make An ImpactAs Zalando transforms from a pure online retailer to a fashion platform, we bring fashion competency and branding expertise to the game by connecting all the players in the industry: consumers, stylists, designers, brands, influencers, and, online and offline stores. By providing a bold mix of global brands, local designers and specialist labels, we create fresh concepts, high-impact campaigns, smart applications and innovative partnerships. We are now searching for a Senior AI Architect to join our Search & Personalisation department. In this role, you will create an overarching AI strategy and drive our success in this exciting and quickly growing field.  You Are Setting StandardsVision. You'll define the strategy and roadmap for analytics, deep learning frameworks, and pioneer the vision to the organization.Implementation. As part of a growing, multi-disciplinary team of Data Scientists and Research Engineers you'll build AI architecture and develop solutions to reinforce the value of data and analytics.Hands-on. You'll provide hands-on support to complex business and technology piloting projects in order to apply theory to solve real-world problems.Mission. You'll cultivate and disperse knowledge and best practices on AI architecture and design development within the engineering team.Ownership.You'll be the owner of Zalando's Global AI architecture documentation and ensure its consistency and alignment with various engineering stakeholders.Team play. You'll embrace architecture development as a collective effort and share your knowledge through coaching, peer reviews, articles, and tech talks. You ArePassionate about Deep Learning. You are a proud PhD degree holder in Computer Science, Computer Architecture, Deep Learning or a related field. Experienced (on a senior level). You can impress us with 12+ years of professional hands-on experience as a (senior) engineer and architect. Your experience is derived from distributed large scale applications requiring research integrations, such as search and personalization or price forecasting systems.Polyglot. You bring an expert level programming skills with Java and JVM based languages, like Scala, and ideally Python.Skilled. You have experience in one or more of the following areas: artificial intelligence, large-scale data mining and machine learning, (including a solid understanding of DL fundamentals).Enthusiastic about solving hard business problems. You love data and analytics in balance with open source technologies.Armed with soft skills. Your effective communication skills paired with your strong analytical competence allows you to simplify complex information and problems.  You Will Benefit FromCulture. Culture of trust and empowerment, open source commitment, meetups, game nights, +70 internal technical and fun guilds, tech talks, product demos, Coderdojos, parties & events.Perks. Competitive salary, 40% Zalando shopping discount, discounts from external partners, public transport discounts, relocation assistance for internationals, free drinks & fruits, hardware of your choice.Development. Tour of Mastery, extensive onboarding, personal branding support, opportunity to attend and speak at conferences.Work Environment. Self-organized, autonomous teams and flexible working hours. Want To Join Us?If you need guidance or have any questions about our hiring processes, please contact us via email: Magdalena Masluk-Meller.
jobtitle: Senior AI Architect (JVM, Machine & Deep Learning) at Zalando SE (Berlin, Germany)

From Fashion Store to Brand Solutions to Business Assurance and Smart Logistics, you will be building the technologies that are utilized as a base for further products and aim to connect all people and parts of the fashion ecosystem.We live Radical Agility - a software development methodology that allows engineers to get work done while management keeps their distance. It is not only about growth and improvement, it is about inventing new things. We strongly believe that providing useful code to the world is a virtue.Along with you, we strive to learn from and contribute to open source software for the betterment of Zalando and the tech community.You Are Setting StandardsVariety. You will add value through innovation by leveraging current trends in software design, frameworks and RESTful web services.Skills & RequirementsYou Are SkilledTechnologies. In contributing to our growing frontend community and becoming part of our internal Web Guild.You Are OfferedCulture. Tour of Mastery, extensive onboarding, personal branding support, opportunity to attend and speak at conferences.Work Environment. Self-organized, autonomous teams and flexible working hours.Want to join us? Then go ahead and apply!!If you need guidance or have any questions about our hiring processes, please contact recruiter Matthias Rempel, Matthias Schmeißer or Antonia Samanns.
