description: Are you keen to help shape future power supply?Are you passionate about writing clean code?Are you a team player for all aspects of the development process?Then this job is for youAs a lead Java developer at Younicos, you will work on our Y.Q platform, which monitors, supervises and controls various electrical grid connected systems like batteries, pv plants, wind farms, thermal generators, transformers, switch gears and auxiliary systems. The development of the Y.Q platform, which runs as 24/7 service on site, is based on OSGi technology and a distributed, messaging-based architecture. Specialized subsystems ensure the optimal control of the electrical components and implement technical interfaces for transmission line operators, energy providers and remote monitoring.As part of an agile team (Scrum) you will work on all aspects of the software development. Strongly modularized system architecture, documentation of the system specifications, test driven Java implementation, fully automated integration testing and building the final product are your day-to-day tasks. Depending on your skills and interests you might work on the core architecture and design of the Y.Q platform, the interface abstraction for the integration of new components, the development of algorithms, the design and development of an API for external systems to give you some ideas.All developments are performed in close collaboration with our technical engineers to understand and implement the technical requirements of the electrical equipment. With your team, you will develop the best technical solutions while having the freedom and the responsibility to bring your innovative ideas to life.Your profileFrom personal point of view:A strong focus on teamwork and a commitment to always let the best idea winExceptional attention to detail, thoroughness and accuracyBasic understanding of the principles of electrical engineering is a plusBasic German is a plusFrom the technical point of view a must isSignificant expertise in Java and experience of other higher programming languagesIntuitive understanding of software architecture and designDesire for writing and testing clean, efficient and reliable codeWelcome isExperience with OSGi, Apache Karaf and Apache Camel or similar technologiesExperience with ActiveMQ and Google Protocol Buffers or other messaging middlewareExpert knowledge of MySQL and/or time series database like TICK stack or PrometheusExperience in micro servicesExperience with BDD/TDD and test automationOur offerThe opportunity to build the technology facilitating higher renewable energy sharesMotivated, passionate colleagues who love to get things doneOpen discussion culture and the opportunity to shape every aspect of your workBright, spacious and comfortable offices in the lovely city of BerlinFlexible working hoursPermanent contract
jobtitle: Senior Java Developer - bring more sun and wind to the power grid (f/m) at Younicos AG (Berlin, Deutschland)

description: solarisBank is the world’s first banking platform. Our goal is to empower finance pioneers - anyone who wants to build something new with banking services. The core of the company is fast, modern technology that makes our banking services quick to setup and simple to build with. We see ourselves as a tech company with a full banking license. Our international team of 90+ colleagues combines digital focus, tech expertise and banking experience. Whether you're a full-stack developer, banker or astronaut, if you're ready to change banking, reach out to us. We love what we do and love our team. Tech as a team together with Product is the agile heartbeat of the company and as engineers we collaborate end-2-end within the company to build great products for our partners and end customers. It is our pride to build state of the art, elegant, straight forward software and it is our professional ambition to deliver value in high quality as early as possible in a sustainable way. The products we deliver are resilient, scalable and performant.As a principal member and a strategic partner of MasterCard, solarisBank is not only working on issuing today’s standard card products but will also work on innovative card products together with MasterCard. The main tech stack is ruby, the API is end-2-end tested and continuously deployed.Your Role:Your primary job is to work as a Software Engineer in the solarisBank tech team.You will report to the Head of Engineering.As a Tech Lead you run one of our small, autonomous, self­-organized scrum product development or productivity teams in order to create, develop, maintain backend / frontend products and services.You help your fellow engineers grow as craftsmen.You act as a liaison for key stakeholders within solarisBank (Product Owner, Agile Coach, Opportunity Team, Management etc.).You ensure your team:has an architecture & tech vision,is aligned with the global architecture,is aligned with architectural inter-connected teams,architecture & vision is represented in tech wide meetings and learning from such meetings are communicated back to your team.Your Profile:You have a deep understanding of modern information technology and agile processesYou gathered relevant work experienceas software developer in a dynamic company environmentleading and shaping a team of peersYou have experiences in the areas of Backend / APIs and Frontend / JS as well as System Design or DevOpsYou feel comfortable in working with our technologies Ruby, Grape, Golang, Elixir, Phoenix, React.js, AWS, Docker, MircoservicesYou have an agile and lean mindset and take end-2-end responsibilityYou are fun to work with and you actively contribute to our company cultureYou have the strong will and ability to learn fast and you are able to explain complex matters to different audiences  You are fluent in English, German is a plusYou have at least one hobby besides coding Our Organization:We are a tech company with a banking license and we change banking forever. We combine the best from the digital world with our unique tech-enabled platform banking approach.Take a deep breath – and get ready to grow at the speed of light: We're a young company and you can shape our destiny from day one.You’ll join a team of experts from tech, entrepreneurship and banking. It's an exclusive combination you'll find in few places other than solarisBank.We're growing rapidly – and you will grow with us. We have a true hands-on mentality which creates lots of opportunities for individual growth.

description: Zalon is the successful story of curating and delivering complete outfits for our customers. Part of Europe's Leading Technology Fashion Platform, we live and breathe excellent software engineering.As part of our recruitment ramp-up for a designated Data Science & Research Engineering team, you, as a Python Backend Engineer will bring the engineering perspective into our products. Expect a role where you will have immediate impact as we iterate fast and experiment a lot, welcoming your innovative engineering ideas to the table. The teams work with full end-to-end responsibility on solving the challenges at hand - starting with ideating over prototyping and user testing to bringing features live and checking their performance.WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FORPython skills (deep understanding of language internals, profiling, best practices, eg. Pandas, Scikit-learn). description: Big dreams often start small. From an idea in a London pub, we have grown into a global cloud enabler which operates across 7 countries and speak over 30 languages.Our purpose at Cloudreach is to “enable innovation”. We do this by helping our customers adopt and harness the power of cloud computing. We believe that the growth of a great business can only be fuelled by great people, so join us in our partnership with AWS, Microsoft and Google and help us build  one of the most disruptive companies in the cloud industry. It’s not your average job, because Cloudreach is not your average company.Our office is located in the heart of Berlin, a short stroll away from Friedrichstraße. See what our employees love about Cloudreach: Life at CloudreachWhich team will you be part of?As a Cloud Architect you are part of the Cloud Enablement team. Our Cloud Enablement team helps provide consultative, architectural, program and engineering support for our customers' journeys to the cloud. The word 'Enablement' was chosen carefully, to encompass the idea that we support and encourage a collaborative approach to Cloud adoption, sharing best practices, helping change the culture of teams and strategic support to ensure success. Our Cloud Architects play a key role in designing and delivering innovative cloud solutions to our customers.How will you spend your days ?We are looking for a Cloud Architect to drive the adoption of Cloudreach services and to inspire customers to innovate using public cloud. We firmly believe that the technical leadership we provide as architects is only as good as our experiences implementing solutions within the industry.You will be :Focusing on one or more strategic customers to ensure a successful delivery of value.Leading and being deeply involved in the hands-on technical delivery of customer projectsDriving solution architecture and best practices by:Contributing to Cloudreach internal toolingProducing white papers and best practices guidesMentoring other fellow Cloud ArchitectsProducing public facing content such as blog posts and presentationsImplementing PoC’s making use of innovative technology by evaluating trending technologiesEnabling clients to visualise the possibilities of leveraging public cloud and the path to get there.Willing to travel to customer sites when focusing on deliveryConstantly investigating and evaluating industry trendsWhat kind of career progression can you expect?You can grow into a Cloud Consultant role, step into a managerial position acting as Architect Lead on customer projects or move into the Cloud Enablement Leader role to support internal teams. Lead positions bring to the fold rewarding mentorship opportunities.There are also relocation opportunities to our other cloudy hubs. How to stand out?Experience with architecting, designing, implementing, and supporting greenfield and/or migration projects using public cloudDeep technical experience in one or more of the following competencies:Software design or development (continuous delivery/integration, adoption of DevOps practices)Systems Operations / ManagementEnterprise ArchitectureInfrastructure DesignIT Security and GovernanceAutomation and System OrchestrationYou have experience with programming, preferably in Python, but at least, in a modern programming language such as Go, Ruby, Java, C++, Perl or .NETExcellent communication skillsCustomer facing experience of a consultative natureYou’ve studied Engineering, Computer Science or a similar subjectWhat are our cloudy perks?MacBook Pro and new smartphone (you will have to choose between Galaxy or iPhone - make the right choice !)Unique 'cloudy' culture: our people are diverse, passionate and easy to work with.Enjoy our uncapped holiday policy and your birthday off.Cloudy University: our continuous learning platform that will provide training and career development opportunities.Monthly meal vouchers which you can use at local restaurants and supermarkets and a Cloudy Lunch on Fridays. Enjoy, it's on us!Private medical and dental care package in addition to the German statutory health care.We kick-off every new financial year by getting together in a cool destination in Europe.
jobtitle: AWS Cloud Architect m/f at Cloudreach (Berlin, Germany)

description: Sick of the Internet Shouting Factory? Endless circular commenting threads? Trolls derailing conversations with ad hominems?So are we.Welcome to Kialo, the purpose-built tool for critical thinking, thoughtful discussion, and collaborative decision-making.After an overwhelming response to our initial launch, we are now looking to massively extend our team of highly skilled software engineers to take on the challenges of building and improving a highly scalable web app.You are thinking on your feet, always coming up with new ideas for applying technology to solve problems? You are designing and living in code? And above all that, you know how to play in a team, because only in a collaborative environment the best ideas can become a reality? In that case we invite you to show off your wizardry of JS, your command of the Python, your dark arts of Unix and to unit test the hell out of it.What we expect from you:You know either JavaScript or Python 3 by heart. Or both, all the better. Even know React and Tornado? Visit us! Pretty please with TypeScript on top!You have a strong opinion about Java, in whatever direction. We don’t use it, btw.Ain’t no SQL. But we’re fine with Postgres, if you insist. Anyway, you know how to store the data. And find it. And read it. You got the idea.You know how to work with and in the cloud.You never stop to learn. We always try out new things, so you better keep up! And we’d love to see even more ideas for even newer things from you.You will plan, design, code, debug, review, test, teach and be taught in a team. Software engineering is a group activity and you can and want to play the game how it’s meant to be played.You are passionate about software. Our team is highly skilled, and we expect no less from you. You love and breathe the code.You know what an argument is. You know how to discuss in a friendly and thoughtful way. You are not afraid to speak out your opinion. That’s what we do.What you can and should expect from us:We have a tech-stack that is fun to work with. And it’s not carved in stone. If you want to work with something else, just build a prototype and convince us.We use the tools that make us efficient. Slack, Jira, Hangouts, GitHub, IntelliJ, Jenkins to name a few. You know about better ones? Please tell us about it.We have an agile process that is tailored to what a developer needs. We do Scrum - automated tests and code reviews included.We give you all the chances to grow and step up your game.We will move to a really, really nice office in the heart of Berlin in April 2018, designed for software development right from the start. With a race track. And without noisy open floor plans. How the heck should anyone think in something like that?We offer hardware of your choosing: Lenovo, MacBook, Razer, Raspberry, you name it. And we pack a pair of funky noise cancelling headphones on top.Drinks, coffee, ice cream, sweets, fruit and at least one lunch a week for free. Ok, working with us may be a minor hazard to your healthy diet.We are the unique opportunity to build and influence a radically new, world-changing thing right at the core. We will always listen to your ideas. Promise.

description: You Are Ready To Make An ImpactAt Zalando Payments, we are processing all financial transactions of Zalando's fashion store and other consumer facing apps. Starting with a flawless user experience in the checkout over the processing of the payments to reconciliation in the backend, we cover the entire financial process to boost conversion and deliver a competitive advantage to our customers through smart risk steering.As a Senior Data Engineer at Zalando Payments, you'll help us to shape the data infrastructure that supports our risk assessment models, responsible for processing Billions of euros every year. You'll be involved into defining the data architecture and given the freedom to select the right mix of technologies to solve whichever problems come your way. Your profileYou are experienced processing data at scale, in batches and streamsSpark, Flink, Kafka, Apache Drill and others are your tools of tradeYou are experienced with RDBMS, NoSQL databases, and have an in-depth understanding of the consistency and availability guarantees they provide.You understand the properties of large distributed systemsYou are keen on understanding the business which your systems will enable and able to balance pragmatism and visionYou Are Setting StandardsVariety. You design, develop, deploy, operate and improve important software solutions that possibly impact millions of customers.Autonomy. Based on our Microservices architecture, you and your team will own your code, and decide on the technologies and tools to deliver as well operate large-scale applications on PaaS/SaaS cloud (AWS).Ownership. You and your team will work like a startup and take ownership for the whole development cycle - from architecture design to testing to implementation and maintenance.Excellence. You will join a team that is dedicated to delivering the highest standards when it comes to the quality of your code and implementation. You will add value by leveraging current trends in software design, architecture and web services.You AreSkilled. In working with production-ready code in at least one JVM language (preferably Scala) and have prior experience in the big data technology landscape. E.g. databases, No-SQL data stores, distributed systems, big data processing frameworks (preferably with Spark)Courageous. description: At ADEX we're working on a real Big Data scale. We analyze and segment daily billions of requests in a YARN/Hadoop cluster of more than 60 machines. In the next phase of development, we are planning to re-design more parts of our Big Data system to make them work in real-time. This will involve the usage of some cutting-edge technologies and also the challenge to extend the on-premise cluster to the cloud.We are therefore seeking a Senior Data Engineer who can design and implement new features of the Big Data DMP (new automated analyses, data aggregation or summarizing). As part of our interdisciplinary, international team you will work on Apache Spark to solve real Big Data problems and optimize our processes. Besides designing and building our new architecture you will convert new business requirements into data processes as well as help maintain our Big Data systems.What we are looking for4+ years experience as a software engineer in a similar roleExcellent skills in JavaWell-versed in SQL, basic mathematics and statisticsWorking knowledge of the Hadoop ecosystem, preferably SparkExperience in working with UNIXFamiliarity with Maven and Git is a strong plusVery good communication skills, fluent in EnglishHaving one or more of the following is not required but nice to haveMachine Learning knowledgeExposure to Scala or Python What we offerWork on real Big Data-scale problems, use technologies available in the market and learn from such a challengingEngineering culture: half of the company works in technical positionsA small international team with different skill sets and backgroundsBright and spacious office easily accessible by public transportation (Tram, S-Bahn, and U-Bahn)Flexible working hours and independent work structureChoose your own equipment26+ days paid vacationGerman lessonsIf this sound exciting to you, please send us your application documents (including your salary expectations and earliest possible starting date). We are looking forward to hearing from you! For further information, please contact Elena Leon at +49 (0) 30 5557313 14.

description: Fantastic opportunities are available in the Oliver Wyman Labs Systems Engineering team in our London and Berlin offices. You’ll be working in smaller, more agile teams than usual. Our philosophy is to liberate our developers to do the best job they can with minimal interference. The position combines the roles of architect, lead developer and team lead. You’ll be immersed in the business side of the work from the start of each project too, so you can shape it to meet the business requirements.  Any success we have had is because of this development model, which we have been refining for almost 20 years, first as LShift, and now as the Systems Engineering team at OW Labs. We work across technologies, platforms, OS’s and industries, which means you will be working on a wide range of projects and will gain a correspondingly wide range of experience, both technical and personal, as an engineer, a developer and as a leader.

description: Deine Herausforderung"Ich möchte in einem Fußballstadion stehen und mit meinem Telefon einen Artikel schreiben und publizieren können." -Julian Reichelt, Vorsitzender der BILD ChefredaktionenUnterstütze uns dabei, für eines der größten Medienportale Europas, ein schlankes und einfach zu bedienendes Content Management System von Grund auf neu zu entwerfen.Dazu setzen wir auf neueste Technologien wie React.js/Redux, Draft.js und Material Design. Im Backend verwenden wir Java 8 mit Spring-Boot und MongoDB Enterprise. Das Ganze lassen wir verdockert in einem Kubernetes Cluster laufen.Unser AngebotWir geben unseren Entwicklern den Freiraum, selbstverantwortlich an der Weiterentwicklung unserer Produkte mit zu arbeiten und so Produktentscheidungen aktiv beeinflussen zu können.Wir investieren in unsere Mitarbeiter mit Schulungen und Trainings und profitieren dabei von unseren Partnerschaften mit Microsoft, Amazon und Apple. Darüber hinaus entsenden wir Kollegen gerne zu internationalen Konferenzen, um verschiedenste Themen und Fachbereiche intern abdecken zu können. (Google I/O, AWS Summits, Apple WWDC, etc.)Ein reiches Seminarangebot im Bereich der Softskills, spannende Konzernaktivitäten, betriebliche Altersvorsorge und Unterstützung für Familien stehen den Mitarbeitern parallel zur Verfügung.Wir bieten unseren Mitarbeitern eine angemessene Bezahlung, ein jährliches Bonussystem und ein attraktives Aktienbeteiligungsprogramm. Dazu erhalten die Angestellten neben Getränken und Obst, freie Mittagskost in einer der besten Kantinen der Stadt.Die Arbeitsplätze sind hochmodern und werden mit hochwertiger Apple Hardware ausgestattet.Wer Lust auf ein spannendes Projekt, mit der Sicherheit eines Großkonzernes im Rücken, anständiger Bezahlung und guten Fortbildungsmöglichkeiten im Herzen von Berlin hat, ist herzlich eingeladen sich zu bewerben.

description: eBay Kleinanzeigen is flexible and fast like a start-up yet we part of the global eBay Family. Our 70-people sized company includes all functions to run our business and do fast decision making. Members of our team value the entrepreneurial spirit, the “can-do” attitude and their mutual respect for each other’s talent and contribution.  We have one of the most-visited sites in Germany and are growing at an amazing speed. Currently, we have about 20 million active ads and more than 15 million monthly unique users – far more than half of them on mobile devices. All this traffic is powered by a set of Java 8/Spring applications and MySQL/Kafka/Cassandra/Elasticsearch servers that serve tens of thousands of requests every second. We use Kanban for development and have up to 10 releases a day, thanks to our fully automated continuous delivery pipeline.  Our 25 people-sized development team is small yet excellent. We build and maintain virtually all software components eBay Kleinanzeigen is made of - from backend to mobile apps. Right now we’re in the middle of a transformation towards a polyglot Apache Kafka based microservice architecture - which means that now is the time to get creative, introduce new technologies, and leave your mark!  To beef up our team we are hiring a Senior Software Engineer - Recommendation / Personalization (f/m).  Tasks and Responsibilities Build scalable low-latency pipelines and components to handle large amounts of data Generate high quality personalized content for our users Be an interface between Product Management, Design, Business and Customers Drive your own ideas for code and process improvement and achieve the next level together with the team Be involved in the whole development lifecycle from planning through architecture to QA and deployment  Requirements Bachelor degree in computer science or equivalent education Passion for beautiful, test-driven code and an eye for simplicity and pragmatism Excellent programming skills in Java, knowledge of one or more other programming languages Experience with data-driven personalization and recommendation solutions Track record of working in high-throughput stream processing or micro-batch environments like Spark, Kafka Streams, Flink, Storm  Beneficial Strong know-how in object-oriented and/or functional design Believer in teamwork and a DevOps mindset Experience with RDBMS and/or NoSQL (e.g. Cassandra, MongoDB, MySQL) Ideally knowledge of search engines (Elasticsearch, Solr) and Hadoop / MapReduce Curiosity to learn new technologies  What do we offer? An excellent working environment, flat hierarchies and challenging work with a diverse, highly skilled and humorous team Competitive salary and great benefits e.g. conference & education budget, company pension scheme, employee stock plans, mobile phone for business and personal use, latest Mac Book Pro, Notebook, PC you name it, home office possibilities etc. International career opportunities throughout eBay Inc. A great campus with free fitness center, basketball and beachvolleyball courts, table soccer, bike rental, coffee-bar, canteen and shuttle-service Free coffee, tea, drinks, snacks, fruit throughout the day

From a technology perspective, we have thousands of devices with our own firmware installed in our customers’ stores around the world and an advanced server infrastructure to manage these devices and process the terabytes of data that they are producing with Machine Learning algorithms. You will have a great opportunity for growing personally and professionally – while having lots of fun along the way.Join our team as a Software Development Intern!What we do all dayWe build most of our applications using Ruby on Rails because we love it. We experiment and try out new things a lot so we are looking for developers who not only like to build new prototypes or minimum viable products and like to be creative, but also have great ideas and enjoy trying them out. We also built our main data processing architecture with Python because we love it. This architecture has been made to scale horizontally and with no single point of failure. We are processing multiple gigabytes of data per hour using different machine learning algorithms.Any interest in data analysis or competence in data science would definitely be a plus.How we work:To be innovative and fast we organise our work using scrum and 1-week sprints.To be as efficient as possible, we reduce the time spent in meetings to the minimum.We love to test and we test all our code – we hope you like it too.We like to do pair programming and code review sessions.Where we work:We have a new office next to Checkpoint Charlie. It is spacious and cozy.There is everything you need to work in a great environment.We have food, fruits, coffee, tea, soda and also a couch with a big TV and a Wii U for the occasional Mario Kart race.Skills & RequirementsRequired skillsSome coding experience (in any language)Appreciated skillsExperience with PythonExperience with Ruby on RailsInterest or experience with data science and analysisWhy there are just a few required skillsWe believe that being a good developer is not so much a question of skills, but more a question of mindset. If you are passionate like us, you love to learn, work and share knowledge with your team, you will be a perfect fit. You will learn with us what is missing.
jobtitle: Software Development Intern at Minodes (Berlin, Deutschland)

description: Do you love big data and analytics? Do you have a strong passion for empirical research and for answering hard questions with data? If yes, you will love working at MiNODES. At the core of our data analytics pipeline we apply advanced machine learning techniques to position people inside our customers' stores based on wifi signals. We are constantly improving these algorithms and are experimenting with new state-of-the art technologies (e.g. deep learning), to deliver the best data quality possible to our customers. With our Data Science team we work hard to help our clients to become industry leader for the future of retail. Therefore we offer an internship where you can apply current state-of-the-art machine learning models on a challenging dataset in an interesting industry.Potential Task you will work on during your internship:Identify potential weaknesses of our own MiNODES Wifi Positioning System and apply current state-of-the-art (e.g. Deep Learning) methods to overcome them.Build new use cases around clients problems that we're able to solve by the use of big data and machine learning techniquesImprove our data quality monitoring infrastructure and help to improve our internal QA ProcessesDuring your time at MiNODES you will be supported by our development and data science team.Skills & RequirementsWe're looking for preferably graduate students from statistics, computer science, business informatics, or related fields with:Excellent statistical intuition and knowledge of various analytical approachesExcellent communication skillsAt least theoretical knowledge of machine learning techniques (both supervised and unsupervised learning)Ability to transfer theoretical concepts to practical implementationsProficient in at least one programming languageAbility to write efficient SQL statementsNot a must, but we appreciate the following skills:Proficient in PythonExperience with Scikit-learn, pandas, scipy, numpy and tensor flowKnowledge of advanced machine learning techniques such as: deep learning, unsupervised outlier analysis, support vector machines, random forests, etc

description: Die Mister Mobile GmbH steht hinter deinhandy.de – der schnellst-wachsenden Plattform im Mobilfunkmarkt und betreut darüber hinaus noch weitere Plattformen im Telekommunikationsbereich. In unserem Büro in Berlin-Mitte arbeiten wir täglich daran, die Sortimente und Angebote aller Anbieter transparent zu vergleichen und den Kunden das Leben etwas einfacher zu gestalten. Wir sind Hersteller- und Providerunabhängig und bieten unseren Kunden so unabhängige, persönliche Empfehlungen und eine One-Stop-Shop-Lösung von der Vertragskündigung, über sein neues Handy und / oder Tarif bis zur gratis Handy-Versicherung und weiteren Lösungen für Wearables, Apps und Smarthome Devices.E-Commerce ist einfach, richtig? Falsch! Jeder der schon mal mit diesem Thema gearbeitet hat wird vermutlich zustimmen, dass das Geschäft von außen immer recht einfach aussieht, es aber erst hinter den Kulissen richtig spannend wird.Bei DEINHANDY. verbringen wir unsere Zeit damit, genau diese spannenden Probleme zu lösen, ohne dabei den Blick auf das Frontend (also das, was der Kunde sieht) zu verlieren. Beides muss für uns in Einklang gut miteinander funktionieren.Wir atmen Code, leben von modernsten Technologien und für den Spaß an der Arbeit mit selbigen und miteinander.Weil wir uns noch viel vorgenommen haben um den Handy- und IOT-Markt weiter zu erobern, suchen wir hierfür Verstärkung in Form von enthusiastischen Web-Entwicklern.

description: The opportunityZalando is transforming from Europe’s leading e-commerce company into a multi-service platform for fashion. From logistics, to big brands, to manufactures - we’re building the platform that connects all people and parts of the fashion ecosystem. As a Data Platform Architect at Zalando, you will be responsible for building, scaling and architecting one of the largest big data platforms in ecommerce. You will develop big data solutions, services, and messaging frameworks to help us continuously process our data faster and more efficiently. You will challenge our status quo and help us define best practices for how we work. And you will have the freedom to launch your own open source projects, contribute to others’ projects, build internal community around your interests, and strengthen your personal brand—while receiving meaningful support at every step.You will work for the Data Services department in Zalando, supporting the teams that are taking care of defining our Big Data strategy. Among the other services that you will help evolve, there are the Data Lake and Nakadi. The Data Lake is a platform that aims to collect all the data and business events generated within Zalando, in near-real-time and batch manner, archive them, offer transformation functionalities and data access that will be used to take data-driven decisions. Nakadi is an Event Bus (open sourced by Zalando) that creates an abstraction layer on top on Apache Kafka (and other distributed streaming platform) providing REST interfaces and several feature like schema validation, schema definition evolution, authentication, authorization.What we are looking forExperience as data architect or senior engineer in larger scale companies in the internet domain like e-commerce, software or infrastructure as a service (SaaS, PaaS), or similarAbility to demonstrate competencies and experience working on time-critical, mass data-processing, parallel data-processing and database initiativesDeep knowledge of big data technologies, like Spark, Flink, Presto, Impala, Hadoop / MapReduce, Google BigQuery and scalable pub/sub event message queues (e.g. Kafka, Kinesis)Solid knowledge of data structures and applied data mining and machine learning techniquesKnowledge of microservice based SOA and service communication using RESTful APIs, GraphQL, gRPC, Avro or other techniques Fluency in at least one programming language, such as Java, Scala or PythonPeerless analytical and critical thinking skills and ability to balance technical trade-offsA great communicator with different stakeholders who is skilled in architecture documentation and technical presentationsEnglish language fluencyYour responsibilitiesDesign and build a cloud-based mass data-processing and log data-processing architecture that will supplement our existing analytics and data warehouse (DWH) architectureAlign multiple teams to apply new big data solutions and provide support as an architect and a peer review partnerHelp evaluate and push for the adoption of technologies that are best suited for specific projectsShare your knowledge via documentation, coaching, code reviews, articles and tech talksDemonstrate excellent communication skills and act as a liaison between your team and othersYou Benefit FromCulture. Culture of trust and empowerment, open source commitment, meetups, game nights, +70 internal technical and fun guilds, tech talks, product demos, Coderdojos, parties & events.Perks. Competitive salary, 40% Zalando shopping discount, discounts from external partners, public transport discounts, relocation assistance for internationals, free drinks & fruits, hardware of your choice.Development. Tour of Mastery, extensive onboarding, personal branding support, opportunity to attend and speak at conferences.Work Environment. Self-organized,  autonomous teams and flexible working hours.Want to join us? Then go ahead and apply!If you need guidance or have any questions about our hiring processes, please contact Taryn Bonugli

jobtitle: Internal IT Engineer / Internal IT Administrator (m/f) at CeleraOne GmbH (Berlin, Deutschland)

description: Ever dreamed of disrupting an entire industry?Join ARGO and change the way companies participate in international trade!Have you ever wondered how Western companies sell goods to countries such as China or Tansania for hundred thousands of Euros without fear of never being paid? We help them do it!ARGO is building a new way to take the risk of non-payment out of international trade transactions, helping companies paying when it’s best for them. We make global transactions as easy as PayPal made it for consumers to buy in the dangerous world wide web.We have just started on our big vision! We are backed by one of the best European VCs, we have a great complimentary management team and are right in the middle of building our first product.But now it’s time for us to get help. We are looking for quality assurance (QA) champions that share our vision of creating a big disruption and want to build something exciting and fresh from the ground up!As core member of our backend team, you will help to ...write and own test cases for our backend and frontend featuresperform acceptance testing for every new featurehunt for bugs and always advocate for covering even the edgiest of edge casessupport our ambitions for automated functional testing (using Protractor)write specs and issues for developers on bugs identifiedBoth in Berlin as well as in a remote position, we offer you...a small team of super smart and driven people that believe in changing things to the betteran informal working atmosphere based upon direct communication and feedback with no bureaucracy or unnecessary disturbance: we believe in Slack, limited meetings and fast honest talkdirect influence on anything we build: We know what we want to do, but if you know a better solution, we will go your way!an environment to grow: learn from your team, help others around you getting better every day, visit conferences, get and give feedback regularly and understand more than just the technical side of our businesslots of additional perks such as awesome team events, regular team lunches and dinners, free of choice hardware,...We hope to find in you...more than one year of experience testing applicationsexperience in analyzing functional requirementsknowledge of bug tracking toolsdesire to conduct all types of testing (functional, acceptance)attention to detail and zeal to get to the heart of the problem during testingability to work in a multicultural teamsomeone who speaks English very well and ideally GermanWe are super excited to hear from you!
